title: Doug Ericksen
deleted: Doug Ericksen has remained controversial throughout his career, taking extreme positions and supporting former President Donald Trump's attempt to overturn the results of the 2020 election.

Despite Ericksen's praise for Cambodia's [https://www.seattletimes.com/opinion/editorials/sen-doug-ericksen-should-break-his-cambodia-deal-or-step-down/ sham elections], when Donald Trump made unsubstantiated allegations about fraud in mail in voting, Eriksen participated in the attack on mail in voting by [https://www.q13fox.com/news/washington-state-senator-to-present-legislation-seeking-end-to-all-mail-voting introducing legislation that mirrored Trumps calls to end mail in voting].

When the House of Representatives impeached Trump in 2021 for his role in the insurrection at the US Capitol, Ericksen attacked Washington State Republican house members, calling them [https://www.yakimaherald.com/opinion/columnists/column-there-s-a-civil-war-all-right-only-right-now-it-s-inside-the/article_fc6e405f-e48c-5bef-b1ab-4af10eeffae8.html?fbclid=IwAR3XGN9zYBO5KZaKwtrfArU3H5g3kddQM23R8L56e6DXKTVXvgSiA2H9hag "Vichy GOP"], a reference to the French Vichy Nazi puppet state that played a prominent role in the Holocaust.
